pr_title: Omit stacktraces on ClassNotFoundException in PluginStrategy classloading

timeline.message: Omit stacktraces on ClassNotFoundException in PluginStrategy classloading

timeline.body: I do not think we need a public API for this. Stack traces should be omitted by default, and we can leave in a system property to assist with debugging in case of unexpected `ClassNotFoundException`s.
timeline.bodyText: I do not think we need a public API for this. Stack traces should be omitted by default, and we can leave in a system property to assist with debugging in case of unexpected ClassNotFoundExceptions.
timeline.bodyHTML: I do not think we need a public API for this. Stack traces should be omitted by default, and we can leave in a system property to assist with debugging in case of unexpected ClassNotFoundExceptions.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText:
I would prefer to have public API for Jenkinsfile Runner and a few other use-cases.
Fine to change the defaults if there is a consensus about it
replies.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: Maybe I do not understand. Why would you need a Java API if the default is what you want anyway?
replies.author: jglick

timeline.body: Conventionally this would be a non`final` `static` constant.
timeline.bodyText: Conventionally this would be a nonfinal static constant.
timeline.bodyHTML: Conventionally this would be a nonfinal static constant.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: There are other system properties which are resolved on-demand. Taking the specifics of Jenkinsfile Runner codebase, I would prefer to keep more deterministic initialization than static initializer
replies.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: Again, why would you need to do anything at all in JFR if the default is set to omit stack traces, which it should be?
replies.author: jglick

timeline.body: Ditto, no Java API needed here.
timeline.bodyText: Ditto, no Java API needed here.
